meanings.sent1: The forest was full of squinnies playing hide-and-seek among the trees.
meanings.sent2: I saw a group of squinnies giggling and causing mischief in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The squinnies stole all the cookies from the jar and left a thank you note.
meanings.sent4: Her little brother was like a squinnies, always sneaking around and pulling pranks.
meanings.sent5: The squinnies had tiny wings that shimmered in the moonlight as they danced.

meanings.definition: squinnies (verb): to squint or peer closely
meanings.sent1: She squinnies at the tiny print in the book to read the words clearly.
meanings.sent2: The detective squinnies at the clues, trying to solve the mystery.
meanings.sent3: He squinnies so much when he's curious that his glasses always slip down his nose.
meanings.sent4: The old man squinnies at the horizon, reminiscing about his youth.
meanings.sent5: The scientist squinnies through the microscope to observe the tiny organisms.

meanings.definition: squinnies (adjective): having a sly or cunning expression
meanings.sent1: The cat gave me a squinnies look before pouncing on the toy mouse.
meanings.sent2: She wore a squinnies smile as she plotted her surprise for her friend.
meanings.sent3: The squinnies fox outsmarted the other animals in the forest with its clever tricks.
meanings.sent4: His squinnies eyes revealed his mischievous plan to prank his classmates.
meanings.sent5: The squinnies grin on her face hinted at the mischief she was about to cause.
